intro: Appendiculopsis sumatrana, commonly known as the Sumatran appendiculopsis, is a species of liverwort found in the tropical regions of Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Porellaceae and is characterized by its small, leafy structure with a distinctive thallus. The plant typically grows on moist, shaded rocks or soil, preferring humid and cool environments. Its morphology includes a central stem with lateral appendages, which are characteristic of the genus Appendiculopsis. This species plays a role in the ecological balance of its habitat by contributing to soil stability and providing microhabitats for other organisms.
